[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: Sim::execute()] [Error Handling] Do execute_serialized_success() and execute_serialized() properly sanitize error messages from inner commands to prevent information leakage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: Sim::execute()] [Match Exhaustiveness] If new Sim variants are added without updating the execute() match statement, can this cause panics or undefined behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: Sim::execute()] [Async Cancellation] If execute() is cancelled mid-operation (e.g., Ctrl+C), can this leave sessions in inconsistent or corrupted state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Struct: Init] [Default Value Attack] If any Init fields have default values via #[clap(default_value)], can these defaults be exploited to bypass security checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Struct: Fund] [Default Value Attack] Are there default values in Fund struct that could allow unintended behavior if users don't explicitly specify all parameters? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Trait: CliCommand] [Command Name Collision] Can command_name() values collide with system commands or other CLI tools, causing confusion attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Async Trait] [Cancellation Safety] Are all async execute() implementations cancellation-safe, or can cancelling at specific await points corrupt session state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [All Commands] [File Parsing] If session files (config.json, delta.json) are maliciously crafted, can Session::load() fail to validate them, leading to arbitrary code execution or memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [All Commands] [Deserialization Attack] Can malicious JSON in session files exploit serde deserialization vulnerabilities to achieve RCE or memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [All Commands] [JSON Bomb] Can attackers create deeply nested or extremely large JSON files that cause excessive memory allocation or stack overflow during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [All Commands] [File Permission] Do session initialization and saving operations set proper file permissions (e.g., 0600) to prevent other users from reading sensitive session data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [All Commands] [Symlink Attack] Can attackers replace session files with symbolic links to cause operations to read/write to unintended locations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Struct: Init] [Network Enumeration] Does ReplayNetworkSelection properly restrict which networks can be specified, or can attackers connect to arbitrary endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: Init::execute()] [DNS Rebinding] When resolving network URLs, can DNS rebinding attacks redirect connections to malicious servers after initial validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Function: Init::execute()] [SSRF] Can the network parameter be exploited for Server-Side Request Forgery attacks against internal network endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [Struct: Init] [Argument Validation] Does clap properly validate PathBuf arguments to prevent control characters or null bytes in paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/sim.rs] [All Structs] [Long Argument Attack] Can extremely long argument values (e.g., 10MB path strings) cause memory exhaustion or buffer overflows? (Medium)
